trans-unit.source: Secure replication traffic of Stateful Services in Azure Service Fabric
trans-unit.target: Secure replication traffic of Stateful Services in Azure Service Fabric

trans-unit.source: When replication is enabled, Stateful Services replicate their state from a primary replica to secondary replicas and such traffic needs to be protected against eavesdropping and tampering.
trans-unit.target: When replication is enabled, Stateful Services replicate their state from a primary replica to secondary replicas and such traffic needs to be protected against eavesdropping and tampering.

trans-unit.source: When replication is enabled, Stateful services replicate state across replicas.
trans-unit.target: When replication is enabled, Stateful services replicate state across replicas.

trans-unit.source: This page is about how to configure protection on such traffic.
trans-unit.target: This page is about how to configure protection on such traffic.

trans-unit.source: There are 2 types of security settings that are supported:
trans-unit.target: There are 2 types of security settings that are supported:

trans-unit.source: X509: Uses X509 certificate to secure the communication channel.
trans-unit.target: X509: Uses X509 certificate to secure the communication channel.

trans-unit.source: Users are expected to ACL certificate private keys to allow Actor/Service host processes to be able to use the certificate credentials.
trans-unit.target: Users are expected to ACL certificate private keys to allow Actor/Service host processes to be able to use the certificate credentials.

trans-unit.source: Windows: Uses windows security(requires Active Directory) to secure the communication channel.
trans-unit.target: Windows: Uses windows security(requires Active Directory) to secure the communication channel.

trans-unit.source: The following section shows how to configure the above 2 types of settings.
trans-unit.target: The following section shows how to configure the above 2 types of settings.

trans-unit.source: The configuration "CredentialType" determines which type is being used.
trans-unit.target: The configuration "CredentialType" determines which type is being used.

trans-unit.source: Store location to find the certificate: CurrentUser or LocalMachine
trans-unit.target: Store location to find the certificate: CurrentUser or LocalMachine

trans-unit.source: Store name to find the certificate
trans-unit.target: Store name to find the certificate

trans-unit.source: Identifies the type of value provided by in the FindValue parameter: FindBySubjectName or FindByThumbPrint
trans-unit.target: Identifies the type of value provided by in the FindValue parameter: FindBySubjectName or FindByThumbPrint

trans-unit.source: Search target for finding the certificate
trans-unit.target: Search target for finding the certificate

trans-unit.source: A comma separated list of certificate common names/dns names used by replicators.
trans-unit.target: A comma separated list of certificate common names/dns names used by replicators.

trans-unit.source: A comma separated list of issuer certificate thumbprints.
trans-unit.target: A comma separated list of issuer certificate thumbprints.

trans-unit.source: When specified, the incoming certificate is validated if it is issued by one of the entries in the list.
trans-unit.target: When specified, the incoming certificate is validated if it is issued by one of the entries in the list.

trans-unit.source: A comma separated list of certificate thumbprints used by replicators.
trans-unit.target: A comma separated list of certificate thumbprints used by replicators.

trans-unit.source: Indicates how the data is protected: Sign or EncryptAndSign or None
trans-unit.target: Indicates how the data is protected: Sign or EncryptAndSign or None

trans-unit.source: Service Principal name registered for the service.
trans-unit.target: Service Principal name registered for the service.

trans-unit.source: Can be empty if the service/actor host processes runs as a machine account (e.g: NetworkService, LocalSystem etc.)
trans-unit.target: Can be empty if the service/actor host processes runs as a machine account (e.g: NetworkService, LocalSystem etc.)

trans-unit.source: A comma separated list of windows identities of all service/actor host processes.
trans-unit.target: A comma separated list of windows identities of all service/actor host processes.

trans-unit.source: Indicates how the data is protected: Sign or EncryptAndSign or None
trans-unit.target: Indicates how the data is protected: Sign or EncryptAndSign or None

trans-unit.source: This snippet shows a sample when all the service/actor host processes run as NetworkService or LocalSystem.
trans-unit.target: This snippet shows a sample when all the service/actor host processes run as NetworkService or LocalSystem.

trans-unit.source: This snippet shows a sample when all the service/actor host processes run as a group managed serice account with a valid ServicePrincipalName.
trans-unit.target: This snippet shows a sample when all the service/actor host processes run as a group managed serice account with a valid ServicePrincipalName.
